text: George David Aiken (August 20, 1892November 19, 1984) was an American politician. He was a member of the Republican Party. He was the 64th Governor of Vermont (1937â€“1941) before becoming a member of the United States Senate for 34 years, from 1941 to 1975. Aiken died at a nursing home in Montpelier, Vermont of a stroke on November 19, 1984 at the age of 92. ==References== Category:1892 births Category:1984 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Governors of Vermont Category:United States senators from Vermont Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Businesspeople from Vermont Category:People from Montpelier, Vermont
title: George Aiken
